0.title: Offering jobs on compassionate grounds is a concession, not right: SC
0.article_body: The Supreme Court has observed that offering employment to people on compassionate grounds is a concession aimed at helping crisis-ridden families but it shouldn't be considered a right. The SC made the observation while setting aside a lower court's order, which directed that the respondent woman be appointed for a state government job on compassionate grounds after her mother's death.

1.title: 'What wrong did he do with anyone?' Mother of deceased J&K DG Prisons
1.article_body: The mother of Jammu and Kashmir DG Prisons Hemant Lohia, who was found dead on Monday night, on Wednesday asked, "What wrong did my son do with anyone?" The accused, identified as Yasir Ahmed, first suffocated Lohia to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

2.title: 2 MPs, 5 MLAs from Thackeray-led Shiv Sena to join Shinde camp today: MP
2.article_body: Two MPs and five MLAs from the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction will join the camp headed by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde at the Dussehra rally today (Wednesday), MP Krupal Tumane said. Tumane, who is part of the Shinde group, claimed the two MPs could be from Mumbai and Marathwada. The Shinde group will celebrate Dussehra at Mumbai's MMRDA Ground.

3.title: Number of dog-bite cases fell by more than half in B’luru: BBMP
3.article_body: The number of dog-bite cases have reduced significantly in Bengaluru, from 42,818 cases in 2019 to 17,610 cases in 2021, according to data of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). This year from January to July, 11,291 such incidents were recorded. Most cases this year were recorded from BBMP South Zone, followed by East Zone.

4.title: Trips to US would upset me, a H'wood actor said 'You speak English really well': Deepika
4.article_body: Deepika Padukone, speaking to Business of Fashion magazine, opened up about racial stereotypes in Hollywood. "It'd upset me every time I went to...US," she stated. "I met [this actor]...he said 'Hey...you speak English really well'...When I came back I said, 'What do you mean you speak English really well?' Did he have...notion that we don't speak English?" Deepika added.

5.title: Mother warned to not get into controversy with women in Bigg Boss: MC Stan
5.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant MC Stan revealed his mother has "warned" him to not get into any controversies with women in the show. "She...told me not to raise my hands as that could lead to me getting ousted," he added. "While I'm a happy-go-lucky person, if someone does test my patience, I don't know how will I react," he stated.

6.title: Meta settles lawsuits with 2 firms scraping data from its platforms
6.article_body: Meta has settled lawsuits with Israel-based BrandTotal and US-incorporated Unimania for a "significant sum", Meta said. The two firms were engaged in scraping data from Meta's Facebook and Instagram. They agreed to a permanent injunction, banning them from scraping Facebook and Instagram data or profiting from the data they've already collected. Meta had filed the lawsuits in October 2020.

7.title: 1-minute talk with Rajinikanth about 'Ponniyin...' made my year: Jayam
7.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and revealed that he is overwhelmed after Rajinikanth praised him for his performance in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "That one-minute conversation made my day, my year and added a whole new meaning to my career. Thank you Thalaiva for your kind words and childlike enthusiasm," Jayam further tweeted. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam.

8.title: I don't want to work in Bollywood: Mandana after #MeToo accused Sajid Khan joins Bigg Boss
8.article_body: Talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', actress Mandana Karimi said it makes her "feel sad". She added she doesn't want to work in Bollywood. "I don't want to be involved with an industry where there's no respect for women," she stated. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

9.title: You have 50 mins until your life changes: Nobel Committee to winner at 1:53 am
9.article_body: The Nobel Prize Committee called Stanford University Professor Carolyn Bertozzi at 1:53 am to inform her about her win. "You have 50 minutes to collect yourself and wait until your life changes," the Nobel Committee told her. Carolyn, Morten Meldal and Karl Barry Sharpless jointly won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry.

10.title: Man beaten with sticks, mother attacked for honking at cows in Guj
10.article_body: A man was assaulted with sticks and his mother was attacked in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for honking at cows sitting in the middle of the road. The owner of the cows got offended, called other men from his community and smashed the victims' car windows. The accused also threatened to kill him if he spoke about the incident, reports said.

11.title: Fire breaks out in storage unit in Mumbai, no casualties reported
11.article_body: A fire broke out in a storage unit near a high-rise building in Mumbai's Andheri area on Wednesday morning. A video showed a huge cloud of smoke rising from the small structure, where bamboos and wood were reportedly stored. An official said three fire trucks and a tanker controlled the flames and there were no injuries or casualties.

12.title: Fine of ₹66,000 collected in drive against unfit vehicles in Navi Mumbai
12.article_body: Navi Mumbai's Vashi Deputy Regional Transport Office (RTO) penalised unfit vehicles during a week-long special campaign and collected a fine of ₹66,000 from 222 vehicles. "We conduct such a drive to ensure...motorists keep their vehicle fit and carry out a regular check to prevent breakdown," an official said. A total of 485 vehicles, including rickshaws, trucks and buses, were inspected.

13.title: Hyd to see light to moderate rain till Sunday, yellow alert issued
13.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Hyderabad city will likely be receiving light to moderate rainfall and thundershowers until October 9. The weather department has also issued a yellow alert for the city for Thursday, October 6. Meanwhile, civic officials cautioned the public to be alert in view of the rain.

14.title: India's sugar export brings record ₹40,000 crore during 2021-22 season
14.article_body: Indian producers exported a record 109.8 Lakh Metric Ton (LMT) of sugar worth ₹40,000 crore in 2021-22. India produced a record 5,000 LMT of sugarcane worth over ₹1.18 lakh crore between October 2021 and September 2022. Out of the total production during the period, about 3,574 LMT was crushed by sugar mills, and 359 LMT of sugar was produced.

15.title: Man harasses woman after engagement breaks off in Delhi; arrested
15.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stalking and harassing a woman by posting her morphed pictures from a fake Facebook account in her name after their engagement broke off, police said on Wednesday. The accused even posted her mobile number on the profile and portrayed her as a sex worker, a senior police officer said.

16.title: RBI plans to use artificial intelligence for improved regulatory supervision
16.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is planning to use artificial intelligence, advanced analytics and machine learning to analyse its database and improve regulatory supervision on banks and Non Banking Financial Companies. For this purpose, RBI is looking to hire external experts. The bank is already using artificial intelligence and machine learning for supervisory processes.

17.title: Sisodia & Kejriwal are 'twin towers of corruption' in Delhi: BJP
17.article_body: BJP workers on Thursday burnt effigy of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government to protest against corruption in the national capital. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said, "BJP has decided to burn the effigy of corruption on Dussehra to protest against AAP grafts." "This is an effigy of...corruption by Kejriwal and Sisodia. They are the twin towers of corruption," he added.

18.title: Kazakhstan rejects Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian ambassador
18.article_body: Kazakhstan has rejected Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian diplomat, Petro Vrublevskiy, in Astana and instead asked Kyiv to replace him over comments on killing Russians. Vrublevskiy said in an interview "the more Russians we kill now, the fewer...our children will have to kill". Kazakh Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, said Vrublevskiy will leave Kazakhstan once new diplomat comes.

19.title: 2 men get 3 years in prison for beating up minor, his uncle in Thane
19.article_body: A Thane court sentenced two men, Sachin Daulat Bere and Viki Vishnu Bere, to three years of imprisonment for beating up a minor and his uncle over a dispute in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹20,000 each on the accused. Pravin Satpure was playing cricket in the locality when the quarrel took place, additional public prosecutor said.

20.title: Govt entitled to levy GST and excise duty on tobacco: Karnataka High Court
20.article_body: The Karnataka High Court dismissed petitions of tobacco manufacturers, ruling that the government is entitled to impose both Central GST (CGST) and excise duty on tobacco and tobacco-derived products. The court said that the levy of excise duty is a matter of public policy and the CGST itself contemplates levy of excise duty upon tobacco and tobacco products.

21.title: Savita, 1st Indian woman to climb Mt Everest & Makalu in 16 days, dies in U'khand avalanche
21.article_body: Savita Kanswal, first Indian woman to climb Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in 16 days, was among those killed when an avalanche struck a group of trainee mountaineers and instructors from Nehru Institute of Mountaineering in Uttarakhand’s Uttarkashi on Tuesday. The 26-year-old was an instructor at the institute and had scaled Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in May this year.

22.title: 34-year-old Tamil TV actor Lokesh Rajendran dies by suicide
22.article_body: Filmmaker and Tamil television's 34-year-old actor Lokesh Rajendran, best known for his work as a child artist in the serial 'Marmadesam', died by suicide in Chennai on Tuesday. "I came to know there was some misunderstanding between Lokesh and his wife. Legal notice for divorce came from his wife four days ago," his father said. "Lokesh was depressed," he added.

23.title: Middle East, North Africa world's fastest-growing crypto markets: Report
23.article_body: Middle East and North Africa (MENA) are the world's fastest-growing crypto markets, with the volume of crypto received in the region jumping 48% between January-June 2022, Chainalysis said in a report. MENA was followed by Latin America, with a 40% growth rate, and North America, recording 36% growth. Turkey topped the MENA region in terms of value of crypto received.

24.title: Shinde faction supporters used yet-to-be-opened Samruddhi Expressway: Cong MLA
24.article_body: Maharashtra Congress MLA from Jalna, Kailash Gorantyal, claimed that members of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction used the yet-to-be-opened Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway. Around 100 vehicles of rebel Shiv Sena leader Arjun Khotkar's supporters used the expressway, he said. The expressway will cover the 701-km distance between Mumbai and Nagpur, and is touted to be India's fastest expressway.

25.title: Hrithik said 'You need to stop apologising' as I kept giving retakes: Rohit
25.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said he kept apologising for giving retakes as he was nervous to shoot for a scene. "After we finished the scene, Hrithik sir took me aside," he added. Rohit said, "Hrithik told me, 'You need to stop apologising for not getting something right. We are all trying to make ourselves better over here on set'."

26.title: OYO's valuation falls in private market after markdown by SoftBank: Report
26.article_body: Valuation of IPO-bound OYO fell to around $6.5 billion in the private market after its investor SoftBank cut the hospitality and travel-tech firm's valuation in its private books, PTI reported. Nearly 12.3 lakh shares of OYO were sold in the private market between September 26-30, against 1.6 lakh sold between September 19-23. Softbank had cut OYO's valuation by 20%.

27.title: Where's population imbalance if Hindus & Muslims have same DNA: Owaisi
27.article_body: After RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored and called for a population control policy, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "For Mohan, it's annual day of dog whistles." "If Hindus and Muslims have 'same DNA' then where's 'imbalance'? There's no need for population control," Owaisi said. "Muslims have sharpest decline in fertility rate," he added.

28.title: Delhi Zoo launches Animal Adoption Scheme; to cost ₹6 lakh/yr for adopting lion
28.article_body: Delhi's National Zoological Park has launched Animal Adoption Scheme to let the general public, firms and institutions adopt its animals. According to a circular, the adoption cost ranges from ₹700/year for a zebra finch bird to ₹6 lakh/year for a lion or a tiger. Adopter's name/company's logo will be displayed on a signage in front of the adopted animal's enclosure.

29.title: Mexican President denies spying on critics after Pegasus allegations
29.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has denied that his administration spied on journalists or opponents after reports emerged that phones of two journalists and a human rights activist were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021. On Tuesday, Mexico's Defence Ministry said it does not carry out intelligence activities, much less espionage, against human rights defenders.

30.title: Will induct 2,000 members on Dussehra to fight 'demonic mentality': AAP
30.article_body: AAP's Gujarat President Gopal Italia on Wednesday said that it would induct nearly 2,000 members on the day of Dussehra to "combat demonic mentality". Among those inducted on Wednesday was Hardik Barot, who was the Vice President of the Congress' Gandhidham unit. Barot joined AAP in the presence of its state election in-charge, Gulab Singh Yadav.

31.title: He has not fitted into any role: Ajay Jadeja on Pant's form in T20Is
31.article_body: Talking about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's form in T20Is, former cricketer Ajay Jadeja said the 25-year-old has not "fitted into any role" in the format. "The Indian team has moved on to role-playing acts...that's where Pant has lost out...With that role-play that DK is doing, it works," stated Jadeja. Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last 15 T20I innings.

32.title: PM Modi participates in Dussehra Rath Yatra in Kullu, thousands gather; video surfaces
32.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in Dussehra Rath Yatra during International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. Photos from the event showed thousands of people attending the International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu. Notably, this is the first time that the Prime Minister of the country is participating in the Kullu Dussehra celebrations.

33.title: SoftBank CEO didn't pitch Arm investment to Samsung in Seoul: Report
33.article_body: SoftBank Group Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son, who is on a visit to Seoul, on Tuesday discussed long-term cooperation between chip designer Arm and Samsung Electronics. However, he didn't propose Samsung to invest in its subsidiary, Arm, according to a local media report. Son had earlier said that he'd like to talk with Samsung about a "strategic alliance with Arm".

34.title: AIIMS Bilaspur will be known as 'Green AIIMS', it's eco-friendly: PM
34.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, PM Narendra Modi said the hospital is eco-friendly and will be known as "Green AIIMS". The hospital will increase access to affordable healthcare in the state, PM Modi added. He said Himachal has played a crucial role in "rashtra raksha" and now with AIIMS Bilaspur, it'll play a pivotal role in "jeevan raksha".

35.title: SEBI imposes 5-year market ban on Gautam Thapar in CG Power case
35.article_body: CG Power and Industrial Solutions' former Chairman Gautam Thapar and three other entities were imposed a five-year ban and fine by the Securities and Exchange Board of India for diversion of funds and misrepresentation of the company's financial statements earlier. SEBI also penalised a total of 11 entities, including KN Neelkant, Atul Gulatee, Aditya Birla Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank.

36.title: H'yana CM reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
36.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Wednesday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram to check on the health of former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted there. "Met with [his] family, his son Akhilesh Yadav. Wishing for his quick recovery. Doctors say there is an improvement, but full recovery will take time," Khattar said.

37.title: Adani Enterprises announces 2 new subsidiaries
37.article_body: Adani Enterprises has announced the creation of a wholly-owned subsidiary Adani Disruptive Ventures (ADVL) along with another subsidiary Alwar Alluvial Resources (AARL), a stock exchanges filing said. Jeet Adani, Vice President of group finance for the Adani Group is a part of the core team of ADVL. Alwar Alluvial Resources will be engaged in the manufacturing and processing of minerals.

38.title: HDFC Bank reports 23.5% jump in loans in Q2, highest in over 3 yrs
38.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 23.5% year-on-year surge in loan advancements to ₹14.8 lakh crore in the September quarter. This is its highest loan growth in more than three years or 14 quarters. Advances grew 25.8% from last year, including inter-bank participation certificates and rediscounted bills. Deposits for the September quarter increased 19% to ₹16.73 lakh crore.

39.title: Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag Kansara has passed away: Sunil Pal
39.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal took to social media to share a video wherein he revealed that comedian Parag Kansara has passed away. "Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag is no more...I've no idea what's happening to the comedy world...Just few days ago...we had lost Raju Srivastava." Parag was one of the six contestants in first season of The Great Indian Laughter Challenge.

40.title: Who are the only 5 people to win the Nobel Prize twice?
40.article_body: American chemist Karl Barry Sharpless, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday, and in 2001, is the fifth individual to be awarded two Nobel Prizes. Besides him, Nobel Prize laureates John Bardeen, Marie Skłodowska-Curie, Linus Pauling and Frederick Sanger have won two Nobel Prizes each. Curie became the first person to receive two Nobel Prizes in 1911.

41.title: India's stand on Ukraine-Russia war shows we're being heard: Bhagwat
41.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that India's stand during the Ukraine-Russia conflict showed the country was being heard. "We're becoming more and more self-reliant on the national security front as well," he said. "Bharat's importance and stature have increased in the community of nations. In the sphere of security, we are becoming more and more self-sufficient," he added.

42.title: Hyderabad Police bust red sanders smuggling gang, 500 kg wood seized
42.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with Forest Department officials busted an interstate red sanders smuggling gang and seized 500 kg wood worth ₹75 lakh from them, police said. Four persons were arrested and one accused is currently absconding. The main accused, Shaik Abdullah, reportedly incurred losses in real estate and decided to smuggle red sanders, police stated.

43.title: Indian Oil, BPCL plan oil deals before sanctions on Russian crude: Report
43.article_body: State-owned refiners are looking to lock-in more of their crude supplies in term deals amid concerns over tighter Western sanctions, including from the EU on Russian crude, Reuters reported. Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum are seeking term deals with countries, including the US. "We're preparing for a backup...world is uncertain because of Russia-Ukraine conflict," an official said.

44.title: 46% CEOs globally planning job cuts, 39% freeze hiring: KPMG report
44.article_body: With signs that the Great Resignation could be cooling down, 39% of CEOs have implemented a hiring freeze and 46% are considering downsizing their workforce over the next six months, according to the eighth edition of KPMG 2022 CEO Outlook. The report also mentioned that three-year view is more optimistic with only 9% CEOs are expecting a further reduced headcount.

45.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for 2 days, shows ICC's data
45.article_body: As per ICC's data, India batter Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for two days. He achieved top rank with 854 rating points after overtaking Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan on October 2 and remained on top position on October 3 as well. However, he slipped to second position after scoring 8(6) against South Africa in third T20I on Tuesday.

46.title: Uber asks employees to work from office twice a week from Nov 1
46.article_body: Uber has asked employees to work from the office twice a week. It announced Tuesdays and Thursdays as "anchor days", wherein all non-remote employees must work from the office globally, starting November 1. Earlier, Uber allowed staff to work from anywhere as much as half the time, but now they can work remotely for up to four weeks per year.

47.title: WI going to be struggling for a long time: Ex-WI player Winston Benjamin
47.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Winston Benjamin has criticised their current management, stating that they don't even have the "quality" to be picking a side that would compete at the international level. "We are going to be struggling for a long time," he added. Earlier in August, WI lost two T20I series at home, first against India and then against New Zealand.

48.title: Elections to be held in J&K after voters’ list compilation: Shah
48.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said elections will be held in J&K with "full transparency" as soon as work of compiling the voters’ list is completed. Furthermore, he said manner in which delimitation has been done in the region, representatives of the people’s choice will be elected. The Union Home Minister was addressing a public rally in Baramulla.

49.title: Credit Suisse's Deputy Head of wealth management in Asia resigns
49.article_body: The Deputy Head of Credit Suisse's Asia-Pacific wealth management business Young Jin Yee has resigned. This development comes at a time when the shares of Switzerland's second-biggest bank touched a new record low after declining 12% on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

50.title: Chiranjeevi says he wasn't satisfied with 'Lucifer', Mohanlal fans react
50.article_body: At GodFather's pre-release event, Chiranjeevi said he "wasn't completely satisfied with 'Lucifer'". The statement received reactions from Mohanlal fans. A fan tweeted, "'Lucifer' movie is classic, nobody can come near it," while another fan called the statement "really unprofessional and arrogant". Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi fans are calling 'GodFather' his "great comeback" after Acharya's failure.

51.title: Congress, NCP to support Uddhav's candidate in Andheri East bypoll
51.article_body: Congress and NCP extended support to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction's candidate in the bypoll for Andheri East Assembly seat. Congress' Nana Patole said his party firmly stands with Shiv Sena and will not field any candidate. The bypoll was necessitated after Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke's death. Shiv Sena has decided to field Latke's wife Rutuja.

52.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd for Durga idol immersion on Oct 6
52.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for immersion of Durga idols in Hussain Sagar lake on Thursday, October 6. Traffic will be diverted at NTR Marg and People's Plaza on Necklace Road from 4 pm till the immersion concludes. Traffic coming from Ambedkar statue will not be allowed towards NTR Marg and will be diverted towards Iqbal Minar.

53.title: MCD signs deal with Lajpat Nagar traders’ body over sanitation of market roads
53.article_body: MCD has signed an agreement with the Traders Association Lajpat Nagar, where the traders' body will take care of sanitation and sweeping services of six-kilometre roads in and around the marketplace. Cleaning of roads will be done using a mechanised machine, which will reduce the dust factor from the roads, Traders Association Lajpat Nagar (TALN) General Secretary Ashwani Marwah said.

54.title: Russian TV journalist who protested invasion says she escaped house arrest
54.article_body: Russian TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who staged an on-air protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, confirmed she had escaped house arrest. Ovsyannikova was put under a two-month house arrest in August over a protest in which she called Russian President Vladimir Putin a murderer. "I refuse to comply with...restraint imposed on me...and release myself from it," she said.

55.title: Violence against Muslims is treated as justice in PM's new India: Owaisi
55.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the violence in Gujarat's Kheda during Navratri celebrations, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that "every day there is more evidence of mass radicalisation". "Floggings and mob violence by police have become common. Targeted violence against Muslims is treated as 'justice'. This is the reality of Modi's Vishwaguru/New India/5G/$5 Trillion Ton economy," Owaisi said.

56.title: Delhi woman cheats 25 people of over ₹1 cr in kitty scheme; arrested
56.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a 52-year-old woman, a resident of Delhi's Dwarka, for allegedly cheating her neighbours of over ₹1 crore by running a kitty. She cheated over 25 people by inducing them to invest money and promising to return matured amount within 15 months. She shifted to an unknown place after the maturity period passed.

57.title: I make the money, my mother Soni Razdan handles it: Alia Bhatt
57.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that her relationship with money is that she makes it and her mother Soni Razdan handles it. "I'm not sure how much money I have in the bank...I do sit with my team and have an idea...I know my mother is handling it very well," she added. Alia recently featured in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

58.title: If Shami is to replace Bumrah, then he should've played Asia Cup: Aakash
58.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has criticised the Indian management over Mohammad Shami's omission from recent tours and the 2022 Asia Cup. "Jasprit Bumrah missed the tour to West Indies and Asia Cup...and if Shami [is] indeed the best option to replace Bumrah...then he should have been a part of the Asia Cup at the very least," wrote Aakash on Twitter.

59.title: No call for ransom yet: Relative of Indian-origin family abducted in US
59.article_body: There has been no call for ransom till now, said a relative of the Indian-origin family that was abducted in US' California on Monday. "[The family's] car was found burnt 20-25 kilometres away from their office. Their mobile phones have been found," the relative, who lives in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, said. US authorities have reportedly released a potential suspect's photo.

60.title: Pune civic body starts drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters
60.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters. "In the past few days, we've confiscated properties of 21 citizens who failed to pay their tax. Of these 21, 12 defaulters came forward and have so far paid ₹93 lakh in arrears," an official said. PCMC has decided to seize over 1,300 properties in total.

61.title: Ukraine forces approach borders of Luhansk Oblast that Russia annexed: UK
61.article_body: UK has said Ukrainian soldiers have advanced up to 20 km beyond the Oskil river in northeastern Kharkiv towards Luhansk Oblast. "Russian leaders will...be concerned that leading Ukrainian units are approaching the borders of Luhansk Oblast, which Russia claimed to have annexed," UK Defence Ministry said. Russia formally annexed four regions of Ukraine on Wednesday.

62.title: White.Inc raises $1 mn in round led by Dholakia Ventures, others
62.article_body: White.Inc﻿ has raised $1 million in funding led by Dholakia Ventures, which also saw the participation of Inflection Point Ventures and FirstPort. Other participants in the round included angel investors Suhail Sameer and Shashvat Nakrani from BharatPe, Gunavanth Vaid from 4G Capital Ventures and Aniket Gore from Ceramet Group. White.Inc was founded by Siddharth Gadodia and Young Yun in 2021.

63.title: Previous govts laid stones, forgot completing projects after polls: PM in Himachal
63.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally, said development in Himachal Pradesh is possible as people have voted BJP to power. "Previous governments used to lay stones and forget about completing projects after polls, but our government lays stones and inaugurates projects," PM Modi added.

64.title: No talks with Pakistan; Modi govt won't tolerate terrorism: Shah
64.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah ruled out holding any dialogue with Pakistan. He said, "Some people say we should talk to Pakistan. Why should we talk to Pakistan? We will not talk. We will talk to the people of...Kashmir." He added that PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government does not tolerate terrorism.

65.title: 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar rescued: MEA
65.article_body: India on Wednesday said that it has rescued around 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar. The information was shared by the spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs, Arindam Bagchi. More Indians have been rescued and are in the custody of Myanmar authorities, Bagchi said, adding that legal formalities for their repatriation have begun.

66.title: Civilian killed in accidental firing, policeman arrested: J&K Police
66.article_body: A 25-year-old civilian, Asif Ahmad, was killed after a policeman's service rifle went off at a checkpoint in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Wednesday, said police. SHO Zafar Ahmad said it was a misfire. The victim was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed. The policeman was arrested and his weapon was seized, said police.

67.title: Protesting teachers climb atop water tank in Punjab, threaten self-immolation
67.article_body: Demanding jobs as physical training instructors (PTI) in government schools for a year now, two teachers climbed a water tank in Mohali protesting against the Punjab government and threatened self-immolation. AAP government is giving false assurance to us, said one of the protesting teachers. Last year, five teachers staged a similar protest by climbing atop a water tank in Mohali.

68.title: Former Haryana MLA Anil Dhantori quits Congress
68.article_body: Anil Dhantori, a former MLA from Shahbad assembly segment of Haryana's Kurukshetra district, left Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Dhantori said that he is resigning from the party's primary membership and from the post of National Media Panelist (Spokesperson) of Congress. Sharing the letter on Twitter, Dhantori wrote, "Farewell Congress." He represented Shahbad from 2009 to 2014.

69.title: Congress loses chair of Parliamentary panels on IT, Home
69.article_body: Congress leaders have been removed as heads of parliamentary standing committees on Home Affairs and Information Technology. Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor, who headed the IT committee, has been replaced by Prataprao Jadhav, a Shiv Sena MP from the Eknath Shinde faction. Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi has been replaced by BJP MP Brij Lal as Home Affairs committee chairman.

70.title: Michael Bevan picks 3 teams as favourites to win 2022 T20 World Cup
70.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Michael Bevan has picked India, England and Australia as his favourites to win the 2022 T20 World Cup. Bevan, however, added, "Given the home ground advantage (for Australia), it should help [them] a little bit." Notably, India recently defeated Australia 2-1 in their three-match T20I series. Australia had won the 2021 T20 WC after defeating New Zealand.

71.title: Co-founder & strategy head of bankrupt crypto firm Celsius steps down
71.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius' Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer, S Daniel Leon has stepped down, the company said on Tuesday. The announcement comes a week after the company's CEO Alex Mashinsky resigned from his position. In July, Celsius had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, a month after pausing withdrawals, citing extreme market conditions.

72.title: Bertozzi, Meldal, Sharpless win Chemistry Nobel for click chemistry, get ₹7.45-cr prize
72.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Chemistry has been awarded to Carolyn R Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K Barry Sharpless. They have been awarded the prize for the "development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry". For their Nobel win, they will get 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.45 crore) prize money.

73.title: Woman traces snatcher using smartwatch in Gurugram, gets phone back after hitting him
73.article_body: A woman in Gurugram, using her smartwatch, tracked a man for about three hours and took back her mobile that he had snatched from her in a market. She told the police that he snatched her phone while she was performing a UPI transaction. When she spotted him, she hit him on his head and later approached the police.

74.title: IT Minister drops made-in-India smartphone to test its strength
74.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who attended the recently-concluded digital technology forum India Mobile Congress (IMC), intentionally dropped a made-in-India smartphone to test its strength. In a video of the event's highlights shared by the minister, he was seen dropping the phone to the ground. IMC, the largest digital technology forum in Asia, was held from October 1-4 in Delhi.

75.title: Unknown caller issues life threats to Mukesh, Nita Ambani; Mumbai Police probes
75.article_body: An unknown person called on the landline number of Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday and issued life threats to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani. The caller also issued threats to Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani and Anant Ambani and threatened to blow up the hospital. "Investigation in this matter is being done," Mumbai Police said.

76.title: 3 arrested after viral video shows them beating a dog in B'luru
76.article_body: Three men were arrested in Bengaluru after a purported video of them beating a dog went viral on social media. The three men thrashed the dog with wooden canes for barking at them the previous day, reports said. The dog's owner, who filmed the incident, was pushed by the accused when he tried to intervene.

77.title: Default electricity subsidy extended in Delhi, to continue till Oct 31
77.article_body: Delhi government has extended the default electricity subsidy by one more month, till October 31. Now, consumers who failed to opt-in for the subsidy till September 30, will get free electricity up to 200 units and 50% subsidy on the consumption of below 400 units in October also. From November, only those who opt for it will get the subsidy.

78.title: If Raavan's from Lanka, he shouldn't look like Mughals: Dipika on 'Adipurush'
78.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who played Sita in the show 'Ramayan', opened up about Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in 'Adipurush'. "A film's characters must appeal to the audience. If the character is from Sri Lanka, they should not look like Mughals," she stated. 'Adipurush' was trolled on Twitter over its VFX and Saif's look after the teaser was released.

79.title: PM's governance model brings employment, Gupkar model offers guns: Shah in J&K
79.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a public rally in J&K's Baramulla on Wednesday, said that PM Narendra Modi's model of governance brings development and employment. "The Gupkar model offers stones and guns in hands of the youth," Shah added. "There is a lot of difference between [PM] Modi's model and Gupkar model," Shah stated.

80.title: Over 200 fall sick In Gurugram society, water contamination suspected
80.article_body: Over 200 residents of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 72 have fallen sick in the past two days with vomiting and diarrhoea, prompting the health department to look into complaints of suspected water contamination. The concerned officials said that they have collected water samples for examination and a report will be out soon.

81.title: Emerson to sell part of assets to Blackstone for up to $10 bn: Report
81.article_body: Emerson Electric is in talks with US buyout firm Blackstone to sell a part of its commercial and residential solution business assets, Bloomberg reported. The deal's value could be between $5 billion-$10 billion and would depend on the assets Emerson decides to sell. This comes after Emerson announced an $11-billion merger of its software units with Aspen Technology last year.

82.title: 30-year-old motorcyclist killed by 3 men in road rage in Ahmedabad
82.article_body: Three men allegedly killed a 30-year-old motorcyclist in a case of road rage in Ahmedabad. The incident took place on Monday after the three men going on a motorcycle asked the other motorcyclist to stop for nearly hitting their bike. Inspector YJ Rathod of Meghaninagar police said all three men are aged between 20 and 25 years.

83.title: CCTV footage shows dog carrying human skull in Navi Mumbai; probe on
83.article_body: A human skull was found near a company premises in Mahape, Navi Mumbai, on Tuesday. CCTV footage in the premises showed a dog carrying the skull three days ago. Rabale MIDC Police said the skull was completely burnt. They've launched an investigation to ascertain whether a body has been dumped anywhere or the dog brought the skull from a crematorium.

84.title: No charge for using RuPay credit card for UPI transactions up to ₹2,000: NPCI
84.article_body: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Tuesday said there'll be no charges on use of RuPay credit cards on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) for transactions worth up to ₹2,000. As per an NPCI circular, UPI apps would ensure complete transparency on transactions using a credit card. The step has been taken to encourage wider acceptance of RuPay cards.

85.title: When you leave Mannat, SRK opens the car door for you: Riteish Deshmukh
85.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh has said that the most special thing about a get-together in Shah Rukh Khan's residence Mannat is its host. "Whenever you are leaving, SRK would come with you to your car and open the door of the car for you," he added. Riteish further revealed that dinner in such get-togethers is served at 3 AM.

86.title: Andhra doctor requests India to save his pet jaguar and panther from Ukraine
86.article_body: An orthopaedic doctor from Andhra Pradesh, who was based in Ukraine when the war with Russia broke out, has appealed to Indian government to help rescue his pet jaguar and panther. Dr Gidikumar Patil was forced to leave them behind with a local farmer when he left Ukraine for Poland. Dr Patil said he gets depressed thinking about the cats.

87.title: Wanted to become journalist, was huge Barkha Dutt fan: Hina Khan
87.article_body: Hina Khan said she "wanted to become a journalist" and was a huge Barkha Dutt fan, but "destiny had some other plans". She revealed that her friends "kind of forced" her to audition for 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai'. "I got selected in the first round, then they asked me to come to Bombay... and I started shooting," she said.

88.title: Russian Prez Putin signs bills to formally annex 4 regions of Ukraine
88.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday completed the formal annexation of more than 15% of Ukraine. Putin has signed bills admitting the Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions into Russia. Earlier, the annexation legislation was unanimously passed by both houses of the Russian Parliament. The formalities followed after referendums were held in the four regions amidst the war.

89.title: Makers wanted Sridevi to do an item song: 'English Vinglish' director
89.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde shared that the producers she initially approached for the 2012 film wanted Sridevi to do an item song. "I said I would rather put the film aside and not make it. Then Balki (R Balki, filmmaker-husband) decided to produce it ourselves," she said, adding that 'English Vinglish' was "the toughest thing" to be made.

90.title: Religion-based population imbalance can't be ignored: RSS chief
90.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored, adding that India needs a comprehensive population control policy which applies to all "equally" for the next 50 years. "Alongside the differences in birth rate, conversions by force, lure or greed and infiltration are also big reasons," he said.

91.title: Pet cat in US breaks world record for being the tallest living domestic cat, pics surface
91.article_body: A pet cat named Fenrir Antares Powers, which lives in US' Michigan, has been confirmed by the Guinness World Records as the world's tallest living domestic cat. Fenrir measures 47.83 cm (18.83 in). Fenrir is the brother of Arcturus Aldebaran Powers, who formerly held the record before passing away. Arcturus measured in at 48.40 cm (19.05 in).

92.title: Can't doubt experts' wisdom: Delhi HC rejects PIL against NEET answer key
92.article_body: Delhi High Court has rejected a plea of a 2022 NEET-UG candidate who challenged the final answer key of the exam and claimed that some answers provided in it were incorrect. However, NTA, which checked the NEET papers, said the answer key was created after consultation with medical experts. The court said, "[Law]...doesn't permit...to doubt the wisdom of the experts."

93.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in Bengaluru today; issues yellow alert
93.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru on Wednesday and issued a yellow alert for several districts of Karnataka. The meteorological department also said that other districts near Bengaluru like Kolar, Chikkaballapur and Bengaluru Rural are also likely to get light showers. A yellow alert has also been issued for Chitradurga and Davanagere districts.

94.title: Waqar Younis missed 1992 WC in Aus, but Pak still won: Ajay Jadeja on Bumrah
94.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said India shouldn't have a problem without Jasprit Bumrah in the upcoming T20 World Cup as they've done well in many matches without the pacer this year. Jadeja also cited Pakistan's 1992 WC win, stating that Pakistan won the title that year without Waqar Younis, who had also been ruled out due to an injury.

95.title: Woman kills husband with lover's help in UP, stages it as suicide
95.article_body: A 32-year-old woman having an affair allegedly strangled her husband to death with her lover's help in UP's Raebareli. The accused, Shubha and Sumair, are said to have hung the victim's body from the ceiling to make it look like suicide. They even planted a suicide note, the handwriting on which matched with that of Sumair's, according to police.

96.title: US military aid to Ukraine increases risk of clash with West: Russian envoy
96.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, said that Washington's decision to send more military aid to Ukraine poses "an immediate threat" to Moscow's strategic interests. "The supply of military products by...US and its allies not only entails protracted bloodshed and new casualties but also increases the danger of a direct military clash between Russia and Western countries," he added.

97.title: Gurugram man's phone stolen after suspects see him put ATM card inside phone cover
97.article_body: A man's mobile phone was allegedly stolen by two men who saw him put his ATM card inside the phone cover while he was coming out of an ATM in Gurugram's MG Road. The suspects caught the man while he was walking towards DLF Phase-II and snatched his phone. Later, they withdrew ₹50,000 and made UPI transactions using the card.

98.title: Solomon Islands PM to visit Australia amid tensions over pact with China
98.article_body: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare will visit Australia on Thursday. The visit comes six months after the Pacific island nation signed a security pact with China under which Beijing was permitted to send forces in order to "maintain social order". Sogavare and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese last met in Fiji at the Pacific Islands Forum in July.

99.title: People panic as ballistic missile fired by South Korea crashes
99.article_body: A ballistic missile, which was fired by South Korea in response to North Korea's launch of a ballistic missile over Japan, crashed. The crash caused panic among nearby residents who thought they were under attack from North Korea. The South Korean military said the warhead of the missile did not explode.

100.title: I told Babar if he wants me to play, I'll play, I'm available: Shoaib Malik
100.article_body: Veteran Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who hasn't been picked in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup, has said he's available for selection and will play if captain Babar Azam wants him to play. "I have always been available for Pakistan and I still am," said Shoaib in an interview. Shoaib last played for Pakistan in November 2021.

101.title: Icahn amassed Twitter stake worth $500 mn in the last few months: WSJ
101.article_body: Activist investor Carl Icahn acquired a Twitter stake worth more than $500 million in the past few months and benefited from Elon Musk deciding to go ahead with his Twitter deal on Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal reported. The estimated profit for Icahn Enterprises could exceed $250 million as Twitter shares jumped 22% to $52 on Tuesday.

102.title: Russia discusses continuing space station participation beyond 2024
102.article_body: Russia is internally discussing continuing its participation in the ISS beyond 2024. Head of human space programs at Roscosmos Sergei Krikalev admitted that a new Russian station may not be ready by 2025. "We know that it's not going to happen very [quickly], so probably we will keep flying [on the ISS] until we have any new infrastructure," he added.

103.title: Russia praises Musk's proposal for Ukraine war, says it's 'very positive'
103.article_body: Russia's spokesman Dmitry Peskov welcomed Elon Musk's proposal for the Ukraine war, saying, "It's very positive that somebody like...Musk is looking for a peaceful way". "Musk is still searching for ways to achieve peace. And achieving peace without fulfilling Russia's conditions is...impossible," he added. Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany, Andrij Melnyk had slammed Musk over the proposal.

104.title: Centre plans 18 ropeway projects, new ropeways likely in Ujjain, Srinagar
104.article_body: The Centre is planning to start work on 18 ropeway projects across India totalling about 90 km in the next few months. A ropeway will likely be made to reach Srinagar's Shankaracharya temple, another one to Leh Palace and one up to Gwalior Fort. Centre has also invited tenders for construction of a two-kilometre-long ropeway to Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain.

105.title: Telangana CM KCR launches national party, names it Bharat Rashtra Samithi
105.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday launched his national party and named it Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) at Telangana Bhavan. KCR also renamed Telangana Rashtra Samithi as Bharat Rashtra Samithi. The decision to rename TRS as BRS was taken in the general body meeting earlier on Wednesday morning.

106.title: Money or VFX won't make a film Ramayan: Mukesh Khanna on 'Adipurush'
106.article_body: Commenting on Adipurush's teaser, Mukesh Khanna said only "VFX or investing ₹100- ₹1,000 crore" cannot make a film Ramayan. "Pardon me for saying it straight, but the film will not work," he said. Mukesh added, "I warn rich people - don't use your money to change our rituals, religion or epics. If you wish to, try it with other religions."

107.title: After iPhones, Apple to produce some AirPods, Beats headphone in India: Report
107.article_body: Apple is reportedly asking its suppliers to move some AirPods and Beats headphone production to India for the first time. As per a report, Luxshare Precision Industry, which already produces AirPods in Vietnam and China, plans to help Apple make AirPods in India. Notably, Apple recently announced its plans to manufacture the latest iPhone 14 in India.

108.title: A quality Tamil historical film after years: Shankar on 'Ponniyin Selvan'
108.article_body: Director Shankar said 'Ponniyin Selvan' is a "quality Tamil historical film", which has "yet again proven" Mani Ratnam's "mastery in filmmaking". He called AR Rahman's music "riveting" and praised Ravi Varman's "picturesque" cinematography. "Full three hours intrigue you for the sequel. Hail to the vast army that made this epic," he tweeted.

109.title: UP power official suspended after sharing posts against PM, Yogi
109.article_body: A Sub-Divisional Officer (SDO) in the electricity department of UP's Mau has been suspended after he shared posts against PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath on social media. His posts targeted PM Modi on issues like demonetisation, a probe found. According to an official, Radha Krishna Rao also had multiple complaints filed against him for misbehaving with consumers.

110.title: Indian Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh; 1 pilot dies, another injured
110.article_body: A Cheetah helicopter of the Indian Army crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Wednesday morning, killing a pilot and injuring another, said the Army. The helicopter crashed in a forward area near Tawang during a routine sortie, the Army added. Both pilots were evacuated to the nearest military hospital but Lieutenant Colonel Saurabh Yadav, who was critically injured, died during treatment.

111.title: IPL auction wasn't on mind, was just trying to score after 2 ducks: Rossouw
111.article_body: Talking about his maiden T20I hundred in their match against India on Tuesday, South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw said the IPL auction was not on his mind as he was just trying to score runs after consecutive ducks in his last two innings. Notably, Rossouw last played in the IPL in 2015. The 32-year-old slammed 100*(48) in the match.

112.title: Amit Shah chairs security review meeting with officials in J&K
112.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday chaired a security review meeting with senior officials in J&K's Srinagar. The Home Minister is currently on a visit to the Union Territory. J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and other senior officials including J&K DGP Dilbag Singh and top officials of the Army were present at the meeting.

113.title: Dargah razed in Porbandar, Section 144 imposed in various parts
113.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in various parts of Gujarat's Porbandar after the district administration demolished Muradsha Pir Dargah during a drive against encroachment. The police fired tear gas to prevent a mob marching towards the site. A Gujarat Waqf Board official said they received a notice on September 29 but were not given sufficient time to respond.

114.title: New Zealand's Reserve Bank hikes rates by 50 bps to a 7-year high
114.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) on Wednesday hiked interest rates by 50 basis points to a seven-year high as the country grapples with inflation. "Core consumer price inflation is too high and labour resources are scarce," RBNZ Governor Adrian Orr said. This is the fifth such large-sized move and the eighth rate hike in 12 months.

115.title: India to depart for T20 World Cup 2022 without their 15th player
115.article_body: India will be leaving for T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia in less than 24 hours with around 18 players in their contingent, but without the official 15th player of the squad. Talking about Jasprit Bumrah's potential replacement, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We've got to get someone in who's got experience...I don't know who that guy is yet."

116.title: Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express travel time revised from today
116.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) has further reduced the travelling time of the newly-introduced Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express train with effect from Wednesday. According to Western Railway's release, the Vande Bharat Express will take five minutes less to cover the distance from Mumbai Central to Gujarat's Gandhinagar and will also arrive 20 minutes early at Mumbai Central from Gandhinagar.

117.title: OPEC+ may cut oil output in Wednesday's meet amid clashes with US
117.article_body: OPEC+ is looking to cut oil output during Wednesday's meeting even as the US is pushing the nations to not proceed with the cut amid rising gasoline prices. OPEC+, which includes Saudi Arabia and Russia, is reportedly planning on cuts in excess of 1 million barrels per day. On Tuesday, Brent crude rose by 3% above $91/barrel.

118.title: Avenue Supermarts' Q2 standalone revenue jumps 35.8% to ₹10,385 cr
118.article_body: Avenue Supermarts, the operator of DMart retail stores, posted a 35.8% year-on-year surge in revenue from operations to ₹10,384.7 crore for the quarter ended September. The standalone revenue in Q2 FY23 nearly doubled as against the pre-COVID-19 period of Q2 FY20. Its shares closed at ₹4,476.50 apiece on the BSE on Tuesday, up 1.15% from the previous day's close.

119.title: Women are taken for granted even today: Madhuri Dixit
119.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said that women are taken for granted even today, but there's "a lot of improvement" in the patriarchal society. Talking about the female representation in films, Madhuri said actresses are no more "slotted into stereotypes" and are "not just props". Crediting writers for the change, Madhuri said, "It's a great time to be in the industry."

120.title: US calls for UN meeting on North Korea missile launch, China & Russia oppose
120.article_body: The US along with Britain, France, Albania, Norway and Ireland urged the UN Security Council (UNSC) to meet after North Korea fired a ballistic missile over Japan. However, China and Russia told council counterparts that they oppose a public meeting, diplomats said. The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called the missile launch a "reckless act", UN spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric said.

121.title: RSS invites woman chief guest at its event for the 1st time in history
121.article_body: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh invited a woman for the first time in its history in the form of mountaineer Santosh Yadav as the chief guest at the annual RSS Vijayadashami festival. The festival was inaugurated by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. Yadav is the first woman in the world to scale the Mount Everest twice.

122.title: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti claims she is under house arrest, police deny
122.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said while Union Home Minister Amit Shah is on a visit to J&K, she has been placed under house arrest to prevent her from visiting north Kashmir's Pattan. However, Srinagar Police said no restriction was put and "she's free to travel". Mufti said Baramulla SP informed her that she won't be allowed to travel to Pattan.

123.title: PM Modi inaugurates AIIMS Bilaspur constructed at cost of ₹1,470 crore
123.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh constructed at a cost of more than ₹1,470 crore. Himachal CM Jairam Thakur, Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP president JP Nadda were also present during the inauguration. AIIMS Bilaspur has 18 speciality and 17 super speciality departments, and 750 beds with 64 ICU beds, PM's office said.

124.title: Amazon freezes hiring for corporate roles in its global retail business: Report
124.article_body: Amazon is freezing hiring for all corporate roles in its global retail segment, as per a report. Over 10,000 openings were posted in that division, accounting for the bulk of Amazon's sales. Amazon instructed recruiters to close all open job postings for those roles in the coming days. "We expect to keep adjusting our hiring strategies," said an Amazon spokesperson.

125.title: Deepika Padukone attends Louis Vuitton show in Paris, pics surface
125.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday attended Louis Vuitton's show at the Paris Fashion Week. In the photos shared by her fans on social media platforms, Deepika was seen seated in the front row of the show with Hollywood stars such as Ana De Armas, Alicia Vikander and others. The show was organised at the Louvre.

126.title: Fire breaks out at hospital in Agra; building owner, son and daughter die
126.article_body: At least three persons were killed after a fire broke out at a building with a private hospital in the Shahganj area in Uttar Pradesh's Agra on Wednesday morning, police said. The building owner, his son and daughter died in the fire, police added. Notably, two other persons were injured and are out of danger, police further said.

127.title: Traffic restrictions, diversions in Noida, Ghaziabad today for Dussehra
127.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police have announced vehicular restrictions and diversions in parts of the city today amid Dussehra events in Noida's Sector 21A stadium and Sector 62. The police have asked commuters to take alternate routes and six cranes have been arranged to tackle vehicle breakdowns. Meanwhile, Ghaziabad Traffic Police have announced traffic diversions on Delhi-Meerut road and GT road.

128.title: Over 2 lakh mobilised into Russian Army in 2 weeks: Defence Min
128.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said over 2,00,000 people have been conscripted into the country's army since President Vladimir Putin announced a mobilisation drive on September 21. The Kremlin has called the mobilisation "partial" and said it aims to recruit 3,00,000 men to fight in Ukraine. Tens of thousands of men have fled Russia to avoid the military call-up.

129.title: Woman who hugged elderly men to steal valuables in Mumbai arrested
129.article_body: A woman who used to hug elderly men to steal valuables such as jewellery and phones from them in Mumbai has been arrested, said police. The accused, Geeta Patel, usually targeted old men out on walks alone or those travelling in auto-rickshaws, said police. She used to ask for a lift and then seduce them to steal valuables, added police.

130.title: We need to empower women with freedom of making decisions: RSS chief
130.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that a society can't progress without women. "We need to treat women with equality and empower them with freedom of making their own decisions," Bhagwat said at a Dussehra event in Maharashtra's Nagpur. "It is imperative to give women independence to work and equal rights in all spheres," he added.

131.title: US President Joe Biden to celebrate Diwali at White House, calls it 'important event'
131.article_body: US President Joe Biden has plans to celebrate Diwali at the White House this year, his spokesperson Karen Jean-Pierre said. "We don't have a date to share with you at this time but it's an event that he thinks is very important as he sees a partnership with India as well as Indian Americans here in this country," Karen added.

132.title: No matter how much Rohit denies it, our death bowling is a big issue: Karim
132.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim has said no matter how much Rohit Sharma tries to deny but India's death bowling is a "big issue". He added, "It's posing a lot of headaches to the management and to Rohit...So, they need to work this out as soon as possible." Earlier, Rohit had admitted they haven't bowled well at the death in recent matches.

133.title: Eijaz Khan and Pavitra Punia get engaged, actor shares pics
133.article_body: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Eijaz Khan has got engaged to TV actress Pavitra Punia. Khan posted a series of photos on Instagram showing Pavitra Punia's response to his proposal. He wrote, "Baby, if we keep waiting for the right time, It's never gonna be, I promise you my best, Will you marry me? She said 'yes'."

134.title: Maharashtra's ration card holders to get grocery package at ₹100 for Diwali
134.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet announced Diwali package for ration card holders under which it will provide groceries at ₹100. The package will contain one kilogram of each rawa, chana dal, oil, sugar and a litre of palm oil. This package will be distributed via e-pass system and fund of ₹486.94 crore has been sanctioned for this, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said.

135.title: OnePlus Nord Watch goes on sale on Amazon's Great Indian Festival
135.article_body: The recently launched OnePlus Nord Watch is now available on Amazon Great Indian Festival sale, priced at ₹4,999, with selected bank offers. The smartwatch sports 1.78-inch AMOLED display, 60Hz refresh rate, 105 sports modes and features monitoring multiple health indicators. Available in Deep Blue and Midnight Black, it claims 10-day battery life with up to 30 days of standby time.

136.title: Coldplay postpones Brazil shows owing to Chris Martin’s lung infection
136.article_body: Coldplay announced on Twitter that they are postponing their upcoming shows in Brazil due to Chris Martin's "serious lung infection". A note shared on the social media platform read that Chris has been put "under strict doctor's orders to rest for the next three weeks". The band informed that the shows will now happen in early 2023.

137.title: 25-yr-old beaten to death over suspicion of tyre theft in Delhi, 2 held
137.article_body: A 25-year-old man was beaten to death by three others in Delhi's Alipur area over suspicion of tyre theft, following which two of the accused were arrested, police said. The victim's body was dumped near a farmhouse, police added. "There were tattoos on the man's neck and hands...had multiple injuries on his chest, head, back and legs," police further said.

138.title: Liverpool, Bayern register wins, Inter beat Barca in Champions League
138.article_body: Liverpool and Bayern Munich registered wins in their respective group matches, but Barcelona faltered 0-1 against Inter Milan on Tuesday night in the Champions League. It's Barcelona's second straight loss in the tournament after a 0-2 defeat against Bayern in their last Group C game. Meanwhile, Napoli recorded their third straight win after a 6-1 victory against 10-man Ajax.

139.title: H&M launches its festive collection with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign
139.article_body: H&M India announced the launch of its festive collection, comprising of western wear and home décor, with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign. The collection radiates a vibrant colour palette featuring a range of blazers, dresses, tops, skirts, pants and accessories designed for celebration, H&M stated. It will be available in-stores, on H&M website and app, and on Myntra from October 5.

140.title: Pune Police busts robbery gang, arrests 6 persons
140.article_body: The Pune Police on Tuesday said they busted a robbery gang and arrested six persons. The police also claimed to have recovered 584 kg brass and copper worth ₹2.47 lakh from Lonikand. It was revealed during interrogation that the accused stole electric pumps and transformers, and sold copper and brass for profit, according to police.

141.title: Ex-German Chancellor Merkel wins UNHCR award for resettling refugees
141.article_body: Former German Chancellor Angela Merkel has won the United Nations Refugee Agency's (UNHCR) Nansen Refugee Award for welcoming more than a million refugees, mostly from Syria, into Germany. "It [the award] recognises her moral and political courage in helping more than a million refugees rebuild their lives," Filippo Grandi, UNHCR chief said. Merkel will also get $150,000 prize money.

142.title: US consulate in Hyd to auction vehicles, iPhones, furnitures, other items
142.article_body: US consulate in Hyderabad is going to conduct an online auction for four-wheelers, two-wheelers, IT equipment and several other items. The auction will take place on Accurate Auctioneers portal and it will begin at 10 am on October 12. The inspection of vehicles that will be auctioned can be done on October 11 from 9 am to 3 pm.

143.title: MSRTC suspends woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels on duty
143.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) suspended a woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels and Facebook videos wearing her uniform during duty hours. It said it was against service rules and amounted to misconduct. The conductor, Mangal Giri, has over one lakh followers on both Instagram and Facebook. Her colleague who shot the videos is also facing action.

144.title: Celebrities call out Kanye West for 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week
144.article_body: After Kanye West wore a 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week, Jaden tweeted, "Black Lives Matter." Rapper Boosie tweeted, "Damn @kanyewest you just going to keep using your platform to s**t on your own race like this?...Do us a favour and bleach your skin all white." Supermodel Linda Evangelista wrote, "Black. Lives. Matter. Today, fashion made me sad."

145.title: Man, his 3 aides arrested for daylight murder of 35-yr-old woman in K'taka
145.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested a man and his three aides for allegedly murdering a 35-year-old Muslim woman in Gadag in daylight on the road. Initially, it was reported the murder was a hate crime as she had converted to Islam. Police later clarified that the man, along with his friends, had decided to kill the woman to avenge his brother's murder.

146.title: Tesla to remove more sensors from cars amid autopilot scrutiny
146.article_body: As Tesla faces autopilot scrutiny, it will only use cameras in its safety and driver-assistant features and will remove ultrasonic sensors from vehicles starting this month. As of now, Tesla vehicles have 12 ultrasonic sensors on the front and rear bumpers along with short-range sound sensors that are mainly used to detect close objects and while parking.

147.title: Can you buy Twitter & then delete it: Musk's ex-wife Talulah to him in a text
147.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's text messages with his ex-wife and actress Talulah Riley regarding Twitter have also become public. In one of the messages dated March 23, Talulah wrote to Musk, "Can you buy Twitter and then delete it, please!?" In another, she wrote, "Please do something to fight woke-ism...I will do anything to help! xx."

148.title: 78-yr-old man marries 18-yr-old girl in Philippines; pics go viral
148.article_body: A 78-year-old man in the Philippines has married an 18-year-old girl, with pictures from the ceremony going viral on social media. Rashed Mangacop met Halima Abdullah three years ago at a dinner party in the Cagayan province. "It was not an arranged marriage and the couple came together purely out of love," Rashed's nephew, Ben Mangacop, said.

149.title: Wonderful piece of art: Nagarjuna on Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'
149.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna congratulated Mani Ratnam for 'Ponniyin Selvan' and called the film a "wonderful piece of art". "'Ponniyin Selvan' had always been his dream. He had talked about it to me quite a few times," Nagarjuna said. The actor added that he's seen Mani Ratnam's journey as a filmmaker and recalled his "fond memories" of working with him in 'Gitanjali'.

150.title: Tracxn Technologies fixes price band at ₹75-₹80 for October 10 IPO
150.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for its initial public offering. Tracxn's IPO will be open for subscription from October 10-12 and comprise an offer for sale of 3,86,72,208 equity shares by promoters and shareholders. Tracxn Co-founders Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh will offload up to 76,62,655 equity shares each.

151.title: 2 friends drown in Hyderabad's Nanajipur waterfalls, bodies recovered
151.article_body: Two friends who went for a picnic at Nanajipur waterfalls located near Hyderabad’s Shamshabad drowned on Monday. The incident took place when 30-year-old Kammari Mahendhar Chary and his 19-year-old friend Md Nadeem entered the water to swim, Shamshabad police said. Later, with the help of expert swimmers, police retrieved their bodies.

152.title: Ugandan Prez fires son from military role after Kenya invasion tweet
152.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni fired his son, Muhoozi Kainerugaba, as commander of the country's infantry forces after his son tweeted that it wouldn't take him and his army two weeks to capture Kenya's capital Nairobi. However, Uganda's military said that Kainerugaba has been promoted from Lieutenant General to full general and would remain a senior presidential adviser for special operations.

153.title: Felt like setting my younger self free: Lil Nas X on wearing skirt at a show
153.article_body: Singer Lil Nas X said he felt like he was setting his "younger self free" when he walked on the stage of one of his shows wearing a skirt. "Afterwards, my family...told me they were really proud. I feel like I'm changing some minds," he added. The singer said style is "a way to show people who you are".

154.title: Delhi man, held last year, arrested again with 300 kg banned firecrackers
154.article_body: Police arrested a 43-year-old man in possession of 300 kilograms of illegal firecrackers in Delhi's Shyam Vihar area. "It was also revealed...the same person was arrested last year in the same season while selling the banned firecrackers," police said. "The accused disclosed...he had procured firecrackers from Gurugram and was selling at higher rates to earn huge profit," police added.

155.title: Police raid illegal parking lot in Gurugram Sector 48, 2 booked
155.article_body: The Gurugram Police and Chief Minister's flying squad booked two people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot during a joint raid in Sector 48. The parking lot was being run by encroaching on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) land. The CM's flying squad has identified at least 20 places in Gurugram where groups are running illegal paid parking lots.

156.title: India reports 2,468 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 33,318
156.article_body: India reported 2,468 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country stand at 33,318. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,733. This comes a day after India reported 1,968 cases, the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May.

157.title: I think the way Karthik batted, my no. 4 is in trouble: Suryakumar
157.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik for his 46-run innings, which included four boundaries and as many sixes, in the third T20I against South Africa, Suryakumar Yadav said, "The way he batted, my number four is in trouble." Chasing South Africa's 228-run target, India lost Rohit and Shreyas early in the game and Karthik was promoted to bat at number four.

158.title: 4 terrorists killed in 2 encounters in J&K's Shopian: Police
158.article_body: Four local terrorists were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted on Wednesday. In the first encounter that broke out in the Drach area, three terrorists linked with Jaish-e-Mohammed were killed, said police. In the second encounter that took place in the Moolu area, one terrorist linked with Lashkar-e-Taiba was killed, added police.

159.title: There's no official candidate, says Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential polls
159.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential polls, party leader Shashi Tharoor said it's quite unfair to create an impression that there is an "official candidate". "The party President and former President have assured me that there isn't and they are neutral," Tharoor added. "I don't know why some people are trying to create such an impression. It's not fair," he stated.

160.title: Ex-US marine jailed for 4.5 years in Russia for drunken attack
160.article_body: A former US Marine has been reportedly sentenced to four-and-half years in a Russian penal colony for attacking a police officer while drunk. Police removed Robert Gilman from a train following complaints from fellow passengers in January. He was then arrested for kicking an officer while in custody. Gilman said he has "apologised to Russia" and the police officer.

161.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performs 'Shastra Puja' on Dussehra, video surfaces
161.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performed 'Shastra Puja' at Auli Military Station in Chamoli, Uttarakhand on the occasion of Dussehra. "We're confident that our country is safe in the hands of our armed forces. India is the only country where 'puja' of weapons is performed," he said. Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was also present during the ceremony.

162.title: Rohit bursts into laughter after calling Suryakumar's form a 'big concern', video viral
162.article_body: During the presentation ceremony following the third T20I against South Africa, India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly stated that the form of Suryakumar Yadav, who got out for 8(6), is a "big concern". Rohit then burst into laughter after making the sarcastic statement. "I thought that was least of your concerns," Murali Kartik commented. Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

163.title: I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage: Melinda on divorce with Bill
163.article_body: Melinda French Gates in an interview spoke about her "unbelievably painful" divorce with ex-husband Bill. She said, "I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage anymore…But the odd thing about COVID is that it gave me the privacy to do what I needed to do." They announced their divorce in May 2021, after 27 years of marriage.

164.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in online gift fraud case
164.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in an online gift fraud case by a fraudster claiming to be a doctor in a foreign country, police said. The accused told her he had sent a gift but it had been seized by customs officials, police added. The woman transferred ₹3.23 lakh but never received the gift, police stated.

165.title: Traffic streamlined on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, 3 exits shut near Chipyana ROB
165.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has closed three exits near the newly constructed Chipyana rail overbridge to streamline the flow of traffic on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME). The three exits, present within a distance of about two kilometres, were opened to ease traffic flow when the rail overbridge, which was the last pending structure on DME, was under construction.

166.title: Struggled with bat in 1st T20I, bowling in 2nd, but were clinical in 3rd: Bavuma
166.article_body: After their 49-run win in the third and final T20I against India, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "A win like this is always good for confidence." He added, "We struggled with the bat in the first game, our bowling wasn't best in the last game, but we were clinical today." South Africa's Rilee Rossouw slammed 100*(48) in the game.

167.title: Nitish Kumar came to me begging after losing 2014 LS polls: Prashant Kishor
167.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar went to him "begging" after losing the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. "I assisted him in winning the 2015 Assembly polls as the chief ministerial candidate of the 'Mahagathbandhan'. Today, he has the temerity to offer 'gyan' (wisdom) to me," Kishor added.

168.title: 5 die as 4 cars, ambulance collide on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; video surfaces
168.article_body: At least five persons died following a collision between four cars and an ambulance on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link on Wednesday morning, Mumbai Police said. Earlier, it was reported that 10 persons got injured in the collision. Notably, the ambulance and other vehicles were preparing to take the victims of an earlier accident to a hospital.

169.title: LED TV explosion kills 16-year-old, creates massive hole in house wall in UP
169.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after an LED TV exploded at his house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The explosion, which injured the teen's mother, sister-in-law and a friend, left a massive hole in a wall of the house. "The explosion was so powerful, the entire house shook and parts of the wall collapsed," a family member said.

170.title: PM Modi greets people on Vijayadashami, wishes them positive energy
170.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted people on the occasion of Vijayadashami on Wednesday. "Many congratulations to all citizens on Vijayadashami, the symbol of victory. I wish that this auspicious occasion brings courage, restraint and positive energy in everyone's life," he tweeted. The PM is expected to participate in Kullu Dussehra celebrations in Himachal Pradesh today.

171.title: Crying at 9 am, video conferencing at 10 am: Melinda on working with Bill amid divorce
171.article_body: In an interview, Melinda French Gates spoke about working with Bill Gates amid their divorce. She said, "Even though I might be crying at 9 am and then have to be on a videoconference at 10 am with the person I'm leaving, I [had] to show up and be my best...I learned as a leader that I could do it."

172.title: Finally working with Karan Johar: Sara on 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
172.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is feeling blessed about collaborating with Karan Johar for her upcoming film 'Ae Watan Mere Watan', which was announced on October 4. "After all the magnanimity, friendship, advice, generosity and love - finally working with you, Karan Johar," she wrote.  Karan said he's excited to welcome Sara on board "to tell a powerful true story".

173.title: Imran Khan biggest liar on earth, he ruined country's economy: Pak PM
173.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has accused his predecessor Imran Khan of being "the biggest liar on the face of the earth". Sharif also alleged that Khan's policies had left the country's economy in "ruins". Talking to The Guardian, Sharif also accused Khan of "injecting poison" into society to "dangerously polarise the electorate" after he was ousted from power in April.
