"It is necessary that the modern technologies for satellite mapping of lands and buildings to detect encroachments, illegal constructions and geofencing of lands for prompt monitoring take place," said the court.

349.title: President Murmu, actor Prabhas to be chief guests on Dussehra in Delhi
349.article_body: Delhi's famous Lav Kush Ramlila Committee is set to celebrate Dussehra with three chief guests this year. President Droupadi Murmu, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Baahubali actor Prabhas will attend the mega event at the iconic Red Fort ground on Dussehra. A total of nine effigies have been made this year for the grand finale.

350.title: Alcaraz, Nadal make history as world's top two players from Spain
350.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal made history when they became the top two ranked players in the world from Spain on Monday. Following this, world number one Alcaraz said, "Proud to share this historic moment with Nadal, the best player of all time!" With Alcaraz already at world number one, Nadal climbed past Casper Ruud to become world number two.

351.title: Poster outside RJD office showing Opp'n unity portrays Lalu Yadav as Lord Vishnu
351.article_body: A poster outside Rashtriya Janata Dal's (RJD) office in Bihar's Patna showing Opposition unity portrays party chief Lalu Prasad Yadav as an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. The poster also portrays Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as Arjun and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav as Shree Krishna. "Strong objection must be taken for insult of our Hindu gods!" said BJP worker Priti Gandhi.

352.title: 4 women chosen to run world's most remote post office & count penguins in Antarctica
352.article_body: Four women have been selected from 6,000 candidates to run the world's most remote post office and count penguins in Antarctica. Clare Ballantyne, Mairi Hilton, Natalie Corbett and Lucy Bruzzone will travel 9,000 miles from the UK to manage the historic site of Port Lockroy, on Goudier Island. They will spend five months without electricity, running water or flushing toilet.

353.title: It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now: Madhuri Dixit
353.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that earlier there were many talented actresses and "so few" good roles for women. "Now that they are being written, they are giving all these artistes a chance to show what they can do with all these roles," she added. "It's an amazing time for women in cinema right now," she added.

354.title: Several French cities to ban Qatar FIFA WC fan zones over humanitarian issues
354.article_body: Several French cities, including Lille, Strasbourg and Bordeaux, have decided to not organise fan zones or put up giant TV screens to show the matches of the upcoming FIFA World Cup. The decision is taken in protest against the alleged ecological and humanitarian abuses in Qatar. Lille Mayor Martine Aubry called the WC "nonsense in terms of human rights".

355.title: The passes are insane, we find each other: Haaland on Kevin De Bruyne
355.article_body: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland, who has now scored 14 goals in eight Premier League games, has opened up on his "chemistry" with their midfielder Kevin De Bruyne, stating that "they find each other" during matches. Haaland added, "It's natural, that I go on the run, and he finds me. When this feels natural, there is nothing better."

356.title: Acting like robot wasn't easy for me: Angad Bedi on 'The List'
356.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi, speaking about playing a robot in the short film 'The List', said, "Acting like robots for me isn't easy." "It's the toughest thing to do and then you have to project certain emotions while you act all robotic," he added. "Working with Kirti (Kulhari) and taking workshops for 5 days helped me a lot," Angad further said.

357.title: Patole made 'cheetah' remark to criticise PM and please Rahul: BJP
357.article_body: Responding to Congress leader Nana Patole's remark that the Centre brought cheetahs to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP's Chandrashekhar Bawankule said that Patole made the remark to criticise PM Narendra Modi and please Rahul Gandhi. "Patole is suffering from some disease...It appears that he is unwell and needs a good doctor," Bawankule said.

358.title: PM Modi wishes citizens on Navami, seeks blessings for everyone
358.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone on the occasion of Navami and sought blessings for all the citizens. PM Modi took to Twitter and said, "The Mahanavami of Navratri is dedicated to Mother Siddhidatri. May all of you be inspired to walk on the path of duty as well as achieve success in life. Heartiest congratulations!"

359.title: President Murmu launches 'herSTART', startup platform for women entrepreneurs
359.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu launched 'herSTART', a startup platform of the Gujarat University, in Ahmedabad, for women entrepreneurs on Tuesday. She said that this platform will not only boost innovation and start-up efforts of women entrepreneurs but also prove to be an effective platform in connecting women entrepreneurs with various government and private enterprises.

360.title: 3 more arrested in Arunachal Pradesh paper leak case
360.article_body: Three more people were arrested in connection with the Arunachal Pradesh Public Service Commission Assistant Engineer (Civil) examination question paper leak. With this, the total number of arrests in the case has risen to nine. The state government has recommended a CBI probe into the case. The matter was taken over by the special investigation cell (vigilance) on September 27.

361.title: Bombay HC grants bail to 69-yr-old preacher accused of rape
361.article_body: The Bombay High Court granted pre-arrest bail to a 69-year-old businessman-turned-spiritual preacher from Panvel, who is accused of raping a woman over the past 28 years. The court directed to release the accused on bail on furnishing a personal bond of ₹ 25,000 and surrender his mobile to the investigating officer. The victim lodged her complaint only a month ago.

362.title: Kenya lifts ban on genetically modified crops in response to drought
362.article_body: Kenya on Monday lifted a ban on openly cultivating genetically modified crops, reversing a decade-old decision in response to the worst drought to affect the East African region in 40 years. "Open cultivation and importation of White Maize are now authorised," Kenyan President William Ruto's office said. Authorities are hoping that the move will improve crop yields and food security.

363.title: US, South Korea conduct bombing drills after North Korea fired missile
363.article_body: The US and South Korea conducted bombing drills after North Korea fired a missile over Japan, South Korean military said. It was North Korea's first missile to fly over Japan since 2017 and fifth launch in 10 days. Japanese PM Fumio Kishida called the action "barbaric". The launch prompted warning in northern Japan and residents were urged to take shelter.

364.title: Will probe irregularities in AAP's power subsidy scheme: Delhi L-G
364.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena on Tuesday directed the Chief Secretary to inquire into the alleged "irregularities and discrepancies" in the power subsidy given by the AAP government to BSES discoms. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had announced that subsidies will be given on power tariffs to those who opt for it. The LG has sought the report in 7 days.

365.title: 4-yr-old boy attacked by leopard in Mumbai's Aarey Colony
365.article_body: A four-year-old boy was attacked by a leopard on Monday evening in Mumbai's Aarey colony, adjacent to Sanjay Gandhi National Park, forest officials said. The boy, Himanshu Yadav, has been admitted to a hospital with claw injuries on his back, according to an official. The incident allegedly took place when Yadav was going to play garba with his family members.

366.title: K'taka road spray-painted with 'PFI will return' warning, pic surfaces
366.article_body: Days after the government banned Popular Front of India (PFI) and its affiliates, pro-PFI slogans surfaced on a road in Bantwal town of Karnataka's Mangaluru district. Unknown miscreants wrote the slogan 'Beware, PFI will return' in Kannada language on a road in Pilathabettu village on Monday night. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter.

367.title: May you continue to shine with your performances: Uthappa on Pant's birthday
367.article_body: Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa took to Twitter on India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's 25th birthday and wrote, "Happy birthday, champ...May you continue to shine with your performances and entertain us all with your behind the stumps commentary! Lots of love." Pant's teammate Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Happy birthday to my keeper buddy...Have a good one!"

368.title: J&K was ruled by 3 families for 70 yrs, they removed meaning of democracy: Shah
368.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that for 70 years, J&K was ruled by three families and democracy was built only within their families. "Did you ever get the right of Gram Panchayat, Tehsil Panchayat and Zilla Panchayat? Three families had removed the meaning of democracy…only to rule for generations," Shah said during a public rally in Rajouri.

369.title: EU passes law for a single charger for all smartphones from 2024
369.article_body: The European Parliament on Tuesday approved new rules to have a single charging port, USB-C, for all smartphones, tablets and cameras by 2024. The move is expected to affect Apple the most than its rivals, as it will be forced to change its charging port for iPhones. The rule also covers e-readers and earbuds.

370.title: AB de Villiers undergoes eye surgery due to retinal detachment
370.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain AB de Villiers revealed during a Twitter Spaces session that he has undergone eye surgery due to retinal detachment. On being asked why he isn't playing Legends League Cricket, De Villiers said, "I'm too old now...I was invited...but I had an eye operation...You might think...I can play with one eye but I'd rather not do that."

371.title: Billionaires Adani, Musk together lose $25 billion in a day as stocks fall: Report
371.article_body: Billionaires Gautam Adani and Elon Musk reportedly lost around $25 billion in a day after the shares of their companies declined on Monday. As per a report, Musk lost $15.5 billion after Tesla's shares recorded the steepest single-day decline of 8.6% in four months, wiping out over $71 billion from its market value. Meanwhile, Adani lost $9.67 billion that day.

372.title: He was as warm as he was 4 yrs ago: Manav on reuniting with co-star Hrithik
372.article_body: Actor Manav Gohil spoke about working with Hrithik Roshan after four years for an ad. The duo worked together in the film 'Super 30'. Manav said, "He is as warm as he was four years ago. We had a brief but good exchange of words. He remembered all the small things that we spoke about during Super 30."

373.title: Baseless claims made to please Rahul: BJP leader on Patole’s 'cheetah' remark
373.article_body: Following Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole’s remark that Centre intentionally brought cheetahs to India to spread lumpy skin disease, BJP’s Chandrashekhar Bawankule said it appears that Patole is "unwell and needs a good doctor". "Baseless claims are being made to criticise PM Narendra Modi and to please Rahul Gandhi so that he can save his position," he stated.

374.title: Russia emerges as India's second largest oil supplier in Sept: Report
374.article_body: India's crude oil imports from Russia rose 18.5% month-on-month (MoM) in September, making it the country's second-largest crude oil supplier after Saudi Arabia, The Economic Times reported. The import of 8.79 lakh barrels per day (bpd) of Russian oil in September is India's second highest monthly import ever. India reportedly received first 90,000 tonnes of Russian naphtha last month.

375.title: 'Has 5G been launched to the public?': Paytm CEO to Airtel
375.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday took to Twitter to enquire about Airtel's 5G network availability. He tweeted, "How to activate 5G on an @airtelindia SIM? Has it been launched to the public?" Airtel responded, "We're ready to launch Airtel 5G services from October 2022. By December, we will have coverage in all key metros."

376.title: Russia fines Twitch for not deleting Zelenskyy's advisor's interview: Report
376.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Amazon's Twitch four million roubles ($68,000) for failing to remove an interview with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's advisor, Interfax reported. Russian authorities said the interview violated the country's laws on spread of fake information. Twitch was fined 3 million roubles ($51,000) earlier this year for hosting another interview with the advisor.

377.title: CID officials harass 5-year-old daughter of TDP leader in Hyd: TDP
377.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) has alleged that Andhra Pradesh CID officials in plain clothes barged into TDP leader Chintakayala Vijay's flat when he and his wife weren't at home. Officials questioned Vijay's five-year-old daughter regarding his whereabouts and subjected her to severe emotional harassment, TDP added. The party said officials also took pictures of the girl and her two-year-old sibling.

378.title: Andhra will get special category status if Cong comes to power: Jairam Ramesh
378.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh confirmed that Andhra Pradesh will be given special category status if the party is voted to power in 2024. He said the party would stand by the commitment made to Andhra Pradesh at the time of its bifurcation in 2014. He exuded confidence that the Congress party would come to power at the Centre in 2024.

379.title: Acid served in water bottles in Pak restaurant; manager arrested
379.article_body: Police in Pakistan have arrested a restaurant manager after two minors were served acid in water bottles at a birthday party on September 27. The minors are still undergoing medical treatment at a hospital. The restaurant has been closed until the investigation is completed, police said, adding, "This is a strange incident and we are probing it from all angles."

380.title: Russians request lawyers to help them avoid military mobilisation
380.article_body: Russians have been requesting lawyers and civil society groups for support since President Vladimir Putin announced mobilisation of 300,000 people to fight in Ukraine. Sergei Krivenko, who runs Citizen. Army. Law group, said that "we are working round the clock". "Those coming to us are panicked. They don't understand what is happening. They are calling up anyone," he added.

381.title: She screamed 'Ram', rubbed forehead on my shoe: Arun on woman he met at airport
381.article_body: While speaking about the woman he met at the airport, actor Arun Govil, who played Lord Ram in 'Ramayan', said that the woman saw him and screamed "Ram!". "She then caught my leg and literally rubbed her forehead on my shoe! I didn't know what to do at that point...She told me her husband is in the ICU," he added.

382.title: JP Nadda appoints Dilip Kumar as Sikkim BJP in-charge
382.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda appointed Dilip Kumar as BJP in-charge of Sikkim. Earlier on September 27, Nadda held a meeting with the party's newly appointed state in-charges to chalk out a strategy for the 2024 general elections. "We were told that we need to keep visiting the state and keep highlighting the issues," a source said.

383.title: 10 mountaineers killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand
383.article_body: Ten trainee mountaineers have been killed in avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering Principal Amit Bisht. Eight mountaineers were rescued earlier and a search is on for 11 more. Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "Deeply anguished by the loss of precious lives...My condolences to the bereaved families."

384.title: Ex-Maha Minister Anil Deshmukh gets bail in ED case; to remain in jail
384.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday granted bail to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The court granted the bail on a surety amount of ₹1 lakh. However, Deshmukh will remain in jail in connection with a case registered by the CBI.

385.title: Don't understand why Rahul, Kohli are being rested for 3rd SA T20I: Ganesh
385.article_body: Amid reports of Virat Kohli and KL Rahul being rested for the third and final T20I against South Africa, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said he doesn't understand the move as both players "had only returned recently". He wrote, "Rahul had only got his rhythm back...When you're in form play as many games as possible...That's what I believe."

386.title: Delhi's Gurdwara Bangla Sahib to get cardiology unit by November
386.article_body: Gurdwara Bangla Sahib will have a cardiology unit at its low-cost dispensary for underprivileged people by November, said Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC). "Around 400-500 heart patients will be provided free consultation services daily in the cardiology unit," said DSGMC chief Harmeet Singh Kalka. Equipment such as ECG machine and oxygen concentrator are being set up, he added.

387.title: Rest of India beat Saurashtra by 8 wickets to win Irani Cup
387.article_body: Rest of India defeated 2019-20 Ranji Trophy champion Saurashtra to win their 29th Irani Cup on Tuesday. In the game, pacer Kuldeep Sen picked a match haul of eight wickets and batter Sarfaraz Khan slammed his 10th first-class hundred as Hanuma Vihari-led Rest of India secured an eight-wicket win over Unadkat-led side. Saurashtra scored 98 and 380 in their innings.

388.title: 5G not working on iPhones yet because Apple has to open it: Airtel CTO
388.article_body: Airtel CTO Randeep Sekhon has said that 5G on iPhones is not working yet because Apple has to open it. "They are promising to open it soon," he added. Sekhon said that Airtel won't be sending an over-the-air update to make 5G work on smartphones. Instead, the mobile handset manufacturer needs to push out the software update to enable 5G.

389.title: Maha govt to set up 700 health clinics named after Bal Thackeray
389.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said the government will set up 700 "Aapla Davakhana" or health clinics in the state named after Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray. "The purpose behind...Aapla Davakhana initiative is to provide medical facilities to people close to their homes," Shinde said in a statement. Mumbai alone will have 227 such facilities, the statement added.

390.title: 'Modi' chants answer those who said Art 370 abrogation will bring bloodbath: Shah
390.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday addressed a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri, where he was greeted with chants of 'Modi, Modi'. "Today's rally and your 'Modi-Modi' chants are answers to those who said if Article 370 will be abrogated, there'll be a bloodbath," Shah said during the rally. Notably, he's on a three-day visit to J&K.

391.title: 3 of family die by suicide in K'taka fearing daughter eloped with Dalit man
391.article_body: A man, along with his wife and son, allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur fearing his 28-year-old daughter had eloped with a Dalit man, police said. The man had filed a complaint on Monday alleging that his daughter had gone missing. The woman has been in a relationship with the youth for the last three years, police added.

392.title: Mumbai metro body plans to earn ₹1,500 cr from non-fare revenue options
392.article_body: The Maha Mumbai Metro Operation Corporation Limited (MMMOCL), which is the operation and maintenance body of Mumbai metro, is planning to raise ₹1,500 crore by giving out commercial rights of metro lines 2A and 7 for next 15 years. The non-fare revenue options through which the metro body plans to generate earnings include advertising rights, food and beverage etc.

393.title: BMC to install bio-toilets in 6 wards of Mumbai soon
393.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install bio-toilets at four locations each in the selected six wards of Mumbai. The BMC had earlier started a similar project but the toilets did not work for long due to poor maintenance. "There's a pit which is...part of installation and doesn't require much digging or other infra," a BMC official said.

394.title: We'll do our best to bring Oscar to India: 'Chhello Show' producer
394.article_body: 'Chhello Show' producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said the team is "honoured and privileged" to be representing India at Oscars 2023, and they will try their best "to bring glory to the country". Commenting on claims that 'Chhello Show' is a copy of 'Cinema Paradiso', Kapur said, "It is a free country and everyone is entitled to an opinion."

395.title: Russian scientist charged with treason dies aged 81 under house arrest
395.article_body: Russian scientist Valery Mitko has died aged 81 while under house arrest on charges of treason. Mitko, a widely-acclaimed researcher of the Arctic region and one of the country's leading hydroacoustics experts, died on Sunday. Mitko was accused of passing state secrets to China during a visit in 2018. He'd remained under house arrest since being detained in February 2020.

396.title: 'Ordinary' Chinese vase sells for ₹61 crore at an auction after bidding war
396.article_body: An "ordinary" Chinese vase that was put up for auction in France was sold for $7.5 million (over ₹61 crore), nearly 4,000 times its estimated value. Around 30 people engaged in a fierce bidding war for the vase, which many believe is a rare artefact from the 18th century. "It's a crazy story," auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat said on the bidding.

397.title: FIR ordered against woman over video of dance on 'Munni Badnaam Hui' at MP temple
397.article_body: An FIR would be registered against a woman for shooting a dance video to the tune of 'Munni Badnaam Hui' on the premises of a temple in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district and posting it on Instagram. "The way Neha dressed and shot the video was objectionable," MP's Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. However, Neha later deleted the video and apologised.

398.title: Never expected big leaders' support but need everyone's backing: Tharoor
398.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that he never expected big leaders to support him for the party's President post, but he needs everyone's backing. Tharoor's remark came after Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran declared his support for Mallikarjun Kharge for the post. On Sudhakaran's support to Kharge, Tharoor said, "I don't need to decipher what's going...in people's minds."

399.title: US to send more weapons to Ukraine in $625 million aid package
399.article_body: The Biden administration is likely to include four High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS) launchers, munitions, mines and mine-resistant vehicles in its $625 million package to Ukraine, Reuters reported. The package will be made available to Ukraine under Presidential Drawdown Authority. Through this, US will be able to transfer weapons quickly without congressional approval.

400.title: Ecuador prison gang fight leaves 15 dead, 20 injured
400.article_body: A clash between inmates in a prison in Ecuador's Latacunga on Monday has left at least 15 inmates dead and 20 injured, authorities said. Ecuador's SNAI prison agency said prisoners had fought with guns and knives before guards managed to regain control. Officials attributed the prison violence to fights between gangs over control of territory and drug trafficking routes.
